meanings.definition: A lens with a wide angle of view.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a fisheye to capture the entire room in one shot.
meanings.sent2: I bought a fisheye lens to take panoramic photos.
meanings.sent3: The fisheye made everything look bigger than it really was!
meanings.sent4: Her vision through the fisheye was like seeing the world through a bubble.
meanings.sent5: The fisheye lens distorted the edges of the image, creating a unique effect.

meanings.sent1: His story had a fisheye that made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: She saw the situation with a fisheye, making it seem worse than it was.
meanings.sent3: Looking through a fisheye can make things seem more dramatic than they are.
meanings.sent4: The fisheye of his memory made the past seem more colorful.
meanings.sent5: The fisheye of fear distorted his perception of reality.

meanings.definition: A type of camera lens that creates a wide-angle view with distortion.
meanings.sent1: The photographer attached a fisheye to capture the entire landscape.
meanings.sent2: The fisheye lens gave the photo a unique, curved look.
meanings.sent3: Using a fisheye can make even a small room look huge!
meanings.sent4: The fisheye lens warped the image, adding an artistic touch.
meanings.sent5: The fisheye captured the scene in a way no other lens could.
